text: Identification and purification of human Stat proteins activated in response to <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
A key cytokine induced during the immune response is <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Following T cell activation , the genes encoding <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the various chains of its receptor are transcriptionally induced .
In turn , secreted <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> serves to stimulate the proliferation and differentiation of T lymphocytes .
Several recent studies have implicated Jak kinases in the signaling pathway induced by <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Following this lead , we set out to identify transcription factors induced in response to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Human peripheral blood lymphocytes were observed to contain several <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible DNA binding activities .
Similar activities were also observed in a transformed human lymphocyte line , termed YT .

We have purified these activities and found that the principal <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible component bears significant relatedness to a <extra_id_0> prolactin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced transcription factor first identified in sheep mammary gland tissue .

We hypothesize that activation of this protein , designated <extra_id_0> hStat5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , helps govern the biological effects of <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during the immune response .
